review: I have been using my laptop to stream anything I want to my HDTV for years. I received a Chromecast for Christmas and after setting it up and seeing what it does, or rather what it doesn't do, I probably will re-gift it.
author: Ponciano Esquivel

review: Love this product ! Simple to set up and works great! I have been streaming movies like crazy with no glitches. I would recommend this product to anyone that lives steaming movies. ! Prices is more than reasonable and works wonderfully!
author: Kathleen L Watts

review: If you don't pay for cable and Netflix and Hulu Plus aren't everything you think they should be, this little gadget will fill in the gaps for those who have to get their dose of YouTube video watching in.  We only have a laptop to manage this device, so a little annoying because they laptop has to be on while you are streaming.  Those that have some type of tablet or smart phone would be able to manage the streaming through those devices.  Easier, not sure?  Easy set up, no problems getting it ready to stream in minutes.  Great gift and price.  Who needs cable?
author: happy shopper

review: We bought it for our son who watches you tube on his phone. This lets him watch all of his saved video's. He was very happy with his xmas gift. We may buy another one because we like it so much. But make sure your television is compatible.
author: Trish

review: The idea and potential is great and the price made it almost too good to be true - and it was.  Here are my pros and cons (and why I replaced it with a Roku)Pros:can control it with your iphone or ipadNetflix and Hulu are availableCons:you can ONLY control it with your iphone or ipad - No remote. I thought it would be ok but it's a pain - especially if you're trying to USE your phone for something else while watching TVNo amazon primeit buffered after the commercial breaks on hulu and was really frustrating.Eventually I gave mine to a friend that wanted to try it and bought a Roku. The Roku I bought was originally $80 and I got it on sale for $40. There is a headphone jack in the remote which my son loves but no one else uses - it's FAST, easy to use, doesn't buffer at all, has AMAZON PRIME! I wouldn't trade it for anything.
author: Amanda "Full Time Mom, Full Time Employee, Wife and hopefully much more. Haven't read an actual book since I was pregnant 5 years ago.  Now I have time to "read" everyday with audio books!"

review: Easily installed on Panasonic television and secure WiFi in VRBO rental.  Other family members able to sign on and queue to share their content.  It was fun!

review: Does what it says it does very well. Warning, it doesn't work on old iPhones, it has to be running d latest software to work. Also, try to use this on a TV that transmits electricity through HDMI, otherwise it has to be permanently connected to a wall jack.
author: Roberto Diaz

review: The player itself was easy to install and it is easy to use, but its scope is limited. I don't subscribe to hulu and I have netflix disc, (not on line). I subscribe to Amazon prime, which is not supported by Chromecast, so right now I am limited to utube viewing.
author: AML

review: I love this![PROS]-Stream straight from the Internet instead of the phone.-Any device can control Chromecast-Hulu & Netflix apps available-Easy initial setup[CONS]-Setup on a new router is frustrating (easier connecting on iPhone than Android for some reason)-No Amazon Insant Video app-No displaying of device images or videoRecommendation: If you don't have a smart TV or are using this for a regular TV, definitely buy. Bought it or my parents in their mid-60s and it's easy enough for them to navigate without issues.
author: Jonathan A. Motz

review: I love this little item. I travel for work often. By taking this with me, I can just plug it in to the hotel tv, and BAM! I can watch whatever I want, and it doesn't cost me $15/movie in the hotel. For the kids, Netflix kills it, so if you are bringing them along, its great! Especially with virtually any childrens programing at your fingertips. I use it with my Kindle Fire 8.9HD and my Nexus 7.2! I use mine in the bedroom, and I am getting one for the living room next. I have cut out $80/ month by dropping my cable provider and just using google play for music and movie rental, netflix for the kids, and HuluPlus, which operates just like regular TV. And I found out that after I canceled all my cable TV, I plugged the coax cable directly into my TV and I get all the channels for free now, local news, ABC NBC PBS Nat Geo, Comedy central, TNT, TBS, Cartoon Network...seriously, best purchase for 2013...along with my Nexus 7.2 :)
